ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Resources and URIs
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Josh, ... Hmm.  Okay, I agree that makes sense from an SQL perspective. But, is that the appropriate mapping of DELETE onto the semantics of HTTP/REST? More

Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Resources and URIs
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=231097723; y=d7pWVvr03NshSeoSUdFPEpBZE27cUha-gtAftJH1yeuHl_V04wd7VOkM-PWK00U
X-Yahoo-Profile: sandhyaprabhakar2000

Hi Josh,

On Nov 18, 2005, at 10:55 AM, Josh Sled wrote:

> On Fri, 2005-11-18 at 10:26 -0800, Dr. Ernie Prabhakar wrote:
>> I personally think constructions like DELETE "parts?part-id=00345"
>> would be extremely confusing.
>
> DELETE FROM parts WHERE part_id = 00345

Hmm.  Okay, I agree that makes sense from an SQL perspective.

But, is that the appropriate mapping of DELETE onto the semantics of  
HTTP/REST?

More precisely, does that SQL potentially delete multiple records  
(where part_id is not the unique key)?

-- Ernie P.
